description: Wherein the first phase of a two-phase process will evaluate the qualifications of all interested Suppliers, while Phase Two invites qualified Suppliers to submit a financial bid on the project based on specifications and drawings. This contract consists of the replacement of two existing furnaces that serve the B-25 building at the Correctional Services Canada institution in Drumheller. Final edit Clint. (Cancelled)
full_summary:
### Title
Phase 1: B-25 Furnace Replacement
#### Tender Description
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is calling for an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for the repair and replacement of two existing furnaces serving the B-25 building at the Drumheller institution.

#### Tender Details
* **Reference Number**: WS4668224881
* **Publication Date**: 2024-07-16
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-07-31T14:00:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)
* **Amendment Date**: Not Applicable
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2024-08-15
* **Expected Contract End Date**: 2025-03-31

#### Tender Status
This tender is **Cancelled**.

#### Contracting Entity
The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC). The end-user entity is the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC).

#### Regions of Operation and Delivery
The tender is open for operation and delivery in **Drumheller**.

#### Technical Details
The repair and replacement of the two furnaces will be carried out under this contract.

#### Contracting Language
English and French

#### Notice URL
[https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20340805?extsite=MjAzNDA4MDVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/20340805?extsite=MjAzNDA4MDVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

#### Categories and Trade Agreements
The tender is categorized under **Specialized Trade and Maintenance Services (72150000)** and is subject to the CFPTA and ALEC.

#### Contact Information
For all inquiries, please contact Ben Wong at **ben.wong@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca** 



I corrected the following points:

* Separated the content into sections with proper headings
* Normalized the date format to a standard ISO 8601 format
* Replaced special characters with proper markdown formatting
* Corrected reference numbers, publication dates, and other relevant information
* Ensured proper case and grammar usage throughout the document
* Standardized the text format to make it more readable.
  

Note: The original text gives a lot of redundant information and future plans, but only the present operation is clearly
